page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: The housing in the study area is of three types.The main type being the barrack blocks of R.A.F Cosford. The other types being the large houses on the farms and estates and the farm cottages and cottages along the A464. The barrack block at Cosford consists of two storey buildings in which airmen have a single private room for living and sleeping in rather like a flat.Nearly 200 airmen are housed in each block. The large estate houses range from Elizabethan to Victorian style houses.Hatton Grange is atypical example of this type.It was built in 1764 and has undergone a number of changes since. Peel Cottage is typical of the third type.It was built in 1894 with only 8 rooms but was extended to 13 rooms in 1973.Many other cottages are modern.
